                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                        <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                            <gmd:organisationName>

                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"
                                        codeListValue="author">author

                        </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                    
                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                        <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                            <gmd:organisationName>
                                <gco:CharacterString>Pictou County Rivers Association</gco:CharacterString>
                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"
                                        codeListValue="contributor">contributor
                                </gmd:CI_RoleCode>
                            </gmd:role>
                        </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Pictou County Rivers Association (PCRA) started monitoring the water quality in the seven main rivers that run through our county in 2014. Approximately every two weeks from late May to early October, PCRA volunteers use portable water quality sensors to measure temperature, dissolved oxygen, pH and conductivity at 2 locations on each river, one just above the head of tide and one in the upper watershed. The program has been conducted every year since 2014 so we have 7 years of data collected and plan to continue the program in 2021. The data collected is compiled and summarized each year and the results compared to previous year’s results and Canadian Water Quality Objectives for the protection of fish and aquatic life. The PCRA acknowledges the technical and financial support provided by the Atlantic Water Network at St. Mary’s University and the NS Salmon Association's Adopt a Stream program which make it possible to conduct this program.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

                codeListValue="onGoing">onGoing</gmd:MD_ProgressCode>
            </gmd:status>

            </gmd:descriptiveKeywords>

            </gmd:language>

            </gmd:topicCategory>

                            </gmd:westBoundLongitude>
                            <gmd:eastBoundLongitude>
                                <gco:Decimal>-62.3025</gco:Decimal>
                            </gmd:eastBoundLongitude>
                            <gmd:southBoundLatitude>
                                <gco:Decimal>45.43253</gco:Decimal>
                            </gmd:southBoundLatitude>
                            <gmd:northBoundLatitude>
                                <gco:Decimal>45.7285</gco:Decimal>
                            </gmd:northBoundLatitude>
                        </gmd:EX_GeographicBoundingBox>
                    </gmd:geographicElement>
                    <gmd:temporalElement>
                        <gmd:EX_TemporalExtent>

                                    <gml:endPosition>2023-08-17T14:00:00+00:00</gml:endPosition>
                                </gml:TimePeriod>
                            </gmd:extent>
                        </gmd:EX_TemporalExtent>
                    </gmd:temporalElement>
                    <gmd:verticalElement>
                        <gmd:EX_VerticalExtent>
                        <gmd:minimumValue gco:nilReason="missing" />

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-0mg9-et50
notes: The Pictou County Rivers Association (PCRA) started monitoring the water quality in the seven main rivers that run through our county in 2014. Approximately every two weeks from late May to early October, PCRA volunteers use portable water quality sensors to measure temperature, dissolved oxygen, pH and conductivity at 2 locations on each river, one just above the head of tide and one in the upper watershed. The program has been conducted every year since 2014 so we have 7 years of data collected and plan to continue the program in 2021. The data collected is compiled and summarized each year and the results compared to previous year’s results and Canadian Water Quality Objectives for the protection of fish and aquatic life. The PCRA acknowledges the technical and financial support provided by the Atlantic Water Network at St. Mary’s University and the NS Salmon Association's Adopt a Stream program which make it possible to conduct this program.

notes_translated.en: The Pictou County Rivers Association (PCRA) started monitoring the water quality in the seven main rivers that run through our county in 2014. Approximately every two weeks from late May to early October, PCRA volunteers use portable water quality sensors to measure temperature, dissolved oxygen, pH and conductivity at 2 locations on each river, one just above the head of tide and one in the upper watershed. The program has been conducted every year since 2014 so we have 7 years of data collected and plan to continue the program in 2021. The data collected is compiled and summarized each year and the results compared to previous year’s results and Canadian Water Quality Objectives for the protection of fish and aquatic life. The PCRA acknowledges the technical and financial support provided by the Atlantic Water Network at St. Mary’s University and the NS Salmon Association's Adopt a Stream program which make it possible to conduct this program.
notes_translated.fr: La Pictou County Rivers Association (PCRA) a commencé à surveiller la qualité de l'eau des sept principales rivières qui traversent notre comté en 2014. Environ toutes les deux semaines, de fin mai à début octobre, les bénévoles du PCRA utilisent des capteurs portatifs de qualité de l'eau pour mesurer la température, l'oxygène dissous, le pH et la conductivité à deux endroits sur chaque rivière, l'un juste au-dessus du niveau de la marée et l'autre dans le haut du bassin versant. Le programme est mené chaque année depuis 2014, nous avons donc 7 ans de données collectées et prévoyons de poursuivre le programme en 2021. Les données recueillies sont compilées et résumées chaque année et les résultats sont comparés aux résultats de l'année précédente et aux objectifs canadiens de qualité de l'eau pour la protection des poissons et de la vie aquatique. La PCRA reconnaît le soutien technique et financier fourni par l'Atlantic Water Network de l'Université de St. Mary's et le programme Adopt a Stream de la NS Salmon Association, qui ont rendu possible la mise en œuvre de ce programme.

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Pictou County Water Quality data

title_translated.fr: Données sur la qualité de l'eau du comté de Pictou
